Breeding adult.description: Lesser Yellowlegs have longer, brighter yellow legs than Solitary Sandpipers.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Lesser Yellowlegs are taller than Solitary Sandpipers. Their backs are mottled while the backs of Solitary Sandpipers are more spotted.

Breeding adult.description: Greater Yellowlegs are bigger with longer and brighter yellow legs than Solitary Sandpipers. Breeding birds have barred flanks while Solitary Sandpipers have unmarked flanks.

Juvenile.description: Greater Yellowlegs are bigger with longer and brighter yellow legs than Solitary Sandpipers.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Stilt Sandpipers have a longer, more drooping bill than Solitary Sandpipers. They also have a pale eyebrow while Solitary Sandpipers have an eyering.
